=== Current Issues ===
==== Nvidia binary driver ====
By default the Nvidias proprietary driver gives you a black screen on VT7, enter VT1 (CTRL+ALT+F1) and update your <code>/etc/X11/xorg.conf</code> and add an '' "Option "!UseDisplayDevice" "DFP" '' line in the '' Section "Device" '':
<pre>
Section "Device"
        ...
        Option          "UseDisplayDevice"       "DFP"
EndSection
</pre>

This bug is tracked by <nowiki>[[https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/82312|bug 82312]]</nowiki>.

==== Suspend to RAM ====
add acpi_sleep=s3_bios to grub boot kernel options. Follow instructions in NvidiaLaptopBinaryDriverSuspend.

=== Hardware details ===
* Intel(R) Pentium(R) 4 CPU 2.53GHz
* 40 GB Harddisk, Hitachi DK23DA-40
* CD-RW/DVD - QSI SBW-161
* NVIDIA GeForce4 440 Go 64 MB, AGP 4 x with TV-out
* 512 Mb DDR RAM
* 10/100 Mbit Fast-Ethernet LAN (RTL8139)
* Internal 56k Modem: Creatix V9x DSP Data-Fax-Mod, Chipset: Intel 536ep
* Sound: SIS7012 PCI
* Synaptics touchpad with 2 buttons and 1 side-scroll (PS/2)
* 3 Multimedia-Hotkeys 
* Li-Ion battery
* 15" TFT XGA Display
* 1 parallelport
* 1 serialport (COM1)
* IEEE 1394 FireWire
* 4 x USB, one of which is 2.0
* PCMCIA 
* Infrared (FIR)
* Line + S/P-DIF out
* Microphone
